How to run a private PIPE network

This tutorial shows you how to run your own node(s) in a private network. This is useful for testing in a private setting. We focus on running from source, so you can use this for develoment purposes as well as testing out experimental features.

1. Make sure you followed Installing pipe-node prior to following this tutorial!

2. run "pipe_node --action=keygen" to generate your keypair.

3. Create a new file named "config_bootstrap.yml" and add the following configuration:

seed: "<Your seed>"
port: 13266
capabilities:
  - PaidStorage
  - Bootstrap
bootstrap_override:
  - <Your address>@127.0.0.1:13266~localhost
storage:
  engine: FileSystemStore
  storage_directory: "./storage"

4. Take the "address" portion from the generated keys and put it in place of <Your address>. A node connects to its own bootstrap if it's the only one! Also, replace <Your seed> by the "Seed:" output from the key generator (only copy the hex values).

5. Open another terminal, and run the command from step 2 again.

6. Create a new file named "config_node_1.yml" and add the following configuration (note that port is missing):

seed: "<Your seed>"
capabilities:
  - PaidStorage
bootstrap_override:
  - <Bootstrap Address>@127.0.0.1:13266~localhost
storage:
  engine: FileSystemStore
  storage_directory: "./storage"

7. Take the address created in step 3 and put it in place of <Bootstrap Address>. Also, replace <Your seed> by the "Seed:" output from the key generator (only copy the hex values).

8. In the first terminal, run "pipe_node --config-file config_bootstrap.yml". Note! It might take some time before PIPE is live for the first time, as it is requesting a SSL certificate...

Tip! Before running the node, you can run "export RUST_LOG=debug" to get logs about what's going on!

9. In the second terminal, run "pipe_node --config-file config_node_1.yml" to start your first node.

10. Congrats, you now run your own private PIPE network. You can connect to your bootstrap using the WASM or Rust libraries and test apps on it!
